dmca.title: A socialite asks Google to get cozy with the DMCA
dmca.body:
[Private]

Direct Dial: [Private]
Direct Fax: [Private]
E-Mail: [Private]
File Number: 22001-00001

September 22, 2006

Via Federal Express
E-Mail to removals@google.com
Google, Inc.
Attn: Google Legal Support DMCA Complaints
[Private]
Mountain View, CA 94043

Re: NOTICE OF COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT 

Dear Ladies and/or Gentlemen:

We represent [Private]. As you may be aware, some time ago, someone hacked into the telephone of Paris Hilton and stole various information, including some private photographs, from Ms. Hilton's phone. Various websites currently display one or more of the stolen photographs which depict a topless Ms. Hilton kissing a fully clothed [Private] (the "Infringing Material"). Ms. Hilton and [Private] are the joint owners of the Infringing Material and neither of them has ever sold or licensed the Infringing Material to anyone. Therefore, the exploitation of the Infringing Material constitutes a violation of US Copyright Law as well as a violation of [Private's] right of publicity and right to privacy.

As required under Sections 512(c)(3) and 512(d)(3) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (17 U.S.C.
dmca.sender_name: Greenburg Glusker Fields Claman & Machtinger LLP
